TITLE: Levi Strauss raises sales outlook on vaccine hopes, shares jump
DESCRIPTION: Levi Strauss & Co on Thursday raised its half-year revenue growth forecast, banking on COVID-19 vaccine rollouts to spur a return to normalcy, after the denim maker beat estimates for quarterly results on a pandemic-led e-commerce boost.

TITLE: Explainer: Amazon's fight against U.S. union could continue even after landmark vote
DESCRIPTION: Officials with the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) are expected to begin counting ballots on Thursday in the closely watched union election at an Amazon.com Inc warehouse in Bessemer, Alabama.

TITLE: U.S. SEC blocks Amazon effort to stop shareholder votes on racial equity audit
DESCRIPTION: U.S. securities regulators on Wednesday turned down an exemption sought by Amazon.com Inc to stop its investors from considering a shareholder proposal related to racial equity at the e-commerce giant.

TITLE: Amazon supports higher corporate taxes in U.S.: Bezos
DESCRIPTION: Amazon.com Inc is in support of a rise in U.S. corporate tax rates, the e-commerce firm's outgoing chief executive officer Jeff Bezos said on Tuesday.

TITLE: EU backs U.S. call for global minimum corporate tax, but rate to be decided
DESCRIPTION: The European Commission backed on Tuesday a call from U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen for a global minimum corporate tax, but said its rate should be decided in talks in the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD).

TITLE: Japan Feb household spending seen down for third straight month: Reuters poll
DESCRIPTION: Japanese household spending likely dropped in February from a year earlier, falling for a third straight month, a Reuters poll found on Friday, suggesting emergency steps to contain the coronavirus infection kept a lid on consumer expenditure.

TITLE: Microsoft wins $21.9 billion contract with U.S. Army to supply augmented reality headsets
DESCRIPTION: Microsoft Corp on Wednesday said it has won a deal to sell the U.S. Army augmented reality headsets based on its HoloLens product and backed by Azure cloud computing services.

TITLE: CD Projekt says every patch brings Cyberpunk closer to PlayStation Store
DESCRIPTION: Poland's video games maker CD Projekt said every patch to its flagship game Cyberpunk 2077 brings the product closer back to Sony's PlayStation, the company's board member said on Tuesday.

TITLE: U.S. accuses China of 'state-led' social media campaign against companies over Xinjiang
DESCRIPTION: The United States on Friday condemned what it called a "state-led" social media campaign in China against U.S. and other international companies for deciding not to use cotton from China's Xinjiang region over forced labor concerns.

TITLE: White House watching China closely on forced labor after U.S. firms pressured
DESCRIPTION: The White House on Friday criticized China for profiting from human rights abuses and said it was watching the issue of forced labor closely after U.S. and other international companies came under attack from Chinese consumers for committing not to use cotton from China's...

TITLE: Airbnb supply gets a boost as vacationers prefer remote stays - AirDNA
DESCRIPTION: U.S. home rental company Airbnb Inc's supply more than doubled over the past four years, while surpassing some of the traditional hotel chains combined, data from analytics firm AirDNA showed on Friday.

TITLE: Sports retailer Fanatics raises $320 million at $12.8 billion valuation in new funding round
DESCRIPTION: Fanatics, the world's biggest licensed sports merchandise retailer, raised $320 million in fresh capital in a funding round that valued the company at $12.8 billion, according to sources close to the deal.

TITLE: Private equity firm Advent has profit over 300% on Brazil deal
DESCRIPTION: Private equity firm Advent International had a profit of around 300% in its investment in Brazilian supermarket chain BIG after agreeing to sell it to Carrefour Brasil for 7.5 billion reais ($1.4 billion), in local currency terms.

TITLE: UK's Sunak says international tax reform is within grasp
DESCRIPTION: British finance minister Rishi Sunak said on Tuesday that he thought reform of the international tax system to reflect the digital world was possible through the co-operation of major world economies.

TITLE: UK shopper numbers edge higher as end of restrictions nears
DESCRIPTION: The number of people heading out to shops across Britain rose by 0.5% in the week to March 20 from a week earlier, the eighth rise in nine weeks despite a national lockdown, market researcher Springboard said on Monday.

TITLE: Mexican judge halts electricity law, as president says top court should rule
DESCRIPTION: A Mexican court ordered a definitive suspension of the government's contentious new electricity law in a ruling published Friday, just as President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador called for the Supreme Court to settle the matter.

TITLE: India antitrust body says Reuters story corroborates evidence in probe of Amazon
DESCRIPTION: India's antitrust body on Friday told a court that a Reuters report showing Amazon.com Inc gave preferential treatment to a small group of sellers on its India platform corroborated evidence it had received and which had triggered an investigation of the U.S. e-commerce...

TITLE: Indian court restrains Future chief from selling assets in dispute with Amazon
DESCRIPTION: An Indian court on Thursday restrained Future Group chief Kishore Biyani from selling his personal assets following Amazon.com Inc's challenge against the Indian group's $3.4 billion sale of its retail business.

TITLE: Exchange leaders say GameStop saga highlights regulatory challenges
DESCRIPTION: The recent trading frenzy around GameStop Corp and other so-called "meme" stocks highlights shortcomings and challenges in the U.S. markets as retail investors become a bigger presence, exchange leaders said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Poland, Hungary win court fight over turnover taxes
DESCRIPTION: Europe's top court ruled on Monday that Polish and Hungarian taxes on turnover targeted by the EU Commission for giving an unfair advantage to small businesses over their bigger, foreign rivals were legal.

TITLE: GameStop leads meme stocks lower, on track for sharp weekly drop
DESCRIPTION: Shares of GameStop Corp slid further in early trade on Tuesday, continuing a slump that has seen the videogame retailer's stock shed a third of its value so far this week.

TITLE: Walmart Canada to invest over C$500 million on store upgrades
DESCRIPTION: Walmart Canada said on Monday it plans to invest more than C$500 million ($400.06 million) this year to refurbish its stores.

TITLE: Billionaire Ackman donates millions of Coupang shares to foundation, others
DESCRIPTION: Billionaire hedge fund investor William Ackman said on Monday he donated 26.5 million shares in newly public South Korean e-commerce giant Coupang Inc to three entities, including his foundation.

TITLE: Amazon Canada asked to shut Brampton facility on COVID-19 concerns
DESCRIPTION: Amazon.com Inc's Canada division has been ordered to close its Brampton facility in southern Ontario, with workers being asked to self-isolate for 14 days, according to a statement from Peel Public Health on Friday.

TITLE: Italy's Benetton group suspends all new orders from Myanmar
DESCRIPTION: Italy's Benetton group on Friday said it had suspended all new orders from Myanmar with immediate effect due to rising violence after the ousting of Aung San Suu Kyi's government last month.

TITLE: Autogrill upbeat on long-term outlook after posting 2020 loss
DESCRIPTION: Autogrill's chief executive said on Thursday he was upbeat about its long-term prospects although the Italian caterer booked a 480 million euro loss last year when the pandemic emptied bars and restaurants it runs in airports and motorways.

TITLE: China's antitrust regulators weigh levying record fine on Alibaba: WSJ
DESCRIPTION: China's antitrust regulators are considering levying a record fine on Alibaba Group Holding Ltd over suspected anticompetitive behavior, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.

TITLE: Jeff Bezos names Andrew Steer as head of Bezos Earth Fund
DESCRIPTION: Amazon.com Inc's Jeff Bezos on Tuesday named Andrew Steer, who leads environmental think tank World Resources Institute, as the president and chief executive officer of his $10 billion Earth Fund.

TITLE: Retail investors' darling stock NanoRepro lures short sellers after 4,000% gain
DESCRIPTION: Fertility testing company turned COVID-19 specialist NanoRepro <NN6G.DE>, which has been a recent darling of German retail investors, has seen a sudden emergence in short selling activity after a dramatic share price surge.

TITLE: Britain's M&S plans smaller store on flagship London site
DESCRIPTION: British retailer Marks & Spencer has proposed a redevelopment of its flagship Marble Arch store in central London that would see the upper levels of the building made into office space, it said on Tuesday.

TITLE: Diageo buys hard seltzer brand Lone River Ranch Water
DESCRIPTION: Johnnie Walker whisky maker Diageo said on Monday it has acquired Far West Spirits LLC, the parent company of Lone River Ranch Water, as it looks to expand in the fast-growing hard seltzer category.

TITLE: GameStop spikes as investors eye cryptic tweet by shareholder
DESCRIPTION: Shares of Reddit-darling GameStop climbed on Thursday, rising more than 20% at one point in yet another unexplained move that left market watchers looking for a possible catalyst.

TITLE: Robinhood, a go-to for young traders, benefits from short sale demand
DESCRIPTION: Robinhood, the online brokerage used by many retail traders to pile in to heavily shorted stocks like GameStop Corp, has made an ambitious push into loaning out its clients' shares to short sellers as it expands its business.

TITLE: Target to invest $4 billion annually to cement pandemic market share gains
DESCRIPTION: Target Corp will invest $4 billion annually over the next several years to open more stores, upgrade existing ones and build-out its supply chain as the retailer tries to cement market share gains made during the COVID-19 pandemic.

TITLE: White House says Biden believes workers should have the right to organize
DESCRIPTION: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said President Joe Biden believes workers should have the right to organize but he will not comment on specific cases that are before the National Labor Relations Board.

TITLE: U.S. SEC suspends trading in 15 securities due to 'questionable' social media activity
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. securities regulator on Friday suspended trading in the securities of 15 companies because of "questionable trading and social media activity," the latest in a string of temporary trading halts amid volatile trading in so-called "meme stocks."

TITLE: Biden on track to apply Trump-era rule targeting Chinese tech supply chain concerns
DESCRIPTION: The Biden administration plans to allow a Trump-era rule targeting Chinese technology firms deemed to pose a threat to the United States to go into effect despite objections from U.S. businesses, the U.S. Commerce Department said on Friday.

TITLE: Robinhood says Munger criticism reflects 'elitist" mindset
DESCRIPTION: Robinhood, a retail brokerage popular with young investors, shot back on Thursday against criticism of the current "meme" stock frenzy by investor Warren Buffett's longtime partner Charlie Munger, who compared the action to betting on horse races.

TITLE: Shift to sun, ski and suburbs gives Airbnb advantage over hotels
DESCRIPTION: Airbnb's quarterly results are likely to show the pandemic may have helped the home rental company lure leisure travelers away from big hotels during the global travel collapse of 2020.

TITLE: Short-sellers lost $818 million on Gamestop bets on Wednesday: Ortex
DESCRIPTION: Short-sellers are estimated to have lost $818 million on Wednesday from their bearish bets on videogame maker Gamestop, data from financial analytics firm Ortex showed.

TITLE: U.S. retail sales in 2021 expected to jump on vaccine, stimulus in positive sign for economy - NRF
DESCRIPTION: U.S. retail sales could rise as much as 8.2% to more than $4.33 trillion this year as more people get the COVID-19 vaccine and the economy reopens, the National Retail Federation (NRF) said on Wednesday.

TITLE: SolarWinds, Microsoft, FireEye, CrowdStrike defend actions in major hack - U.S. Senate hearing
DESCRIPTION: Top executives at Texas-based software company SolarWinds Corp, Microsoft Corp and cybersecurity firms FireEye Inc and CrowdStrike Holdings Inc defended their conduct in breaches blamed on Russian hackers and sought to shift responsibility elsewhere in testimony to a U.S...

TITLE: Statistics Canada revises up two core measures of inflation for January
DESCRIPTION: Two of three core measures of Canadian inflation watched closely by the Bank of Canada were revised upward on Monday, as Statistics Canada reversed methodological changes made ahead of its last release that made the January data appear weaker.

TITLE: Citadel's Griffin says firm does not use personal information of retail investors: CNBC
DESCRIPTION: Market maker Citadel Securities does not use the personal information of retail investors, its billionaire co-founder Ken Griffin told CNBC on Friday, a day after the U.S. congressional hearing on GameStop.

TITLE: Mexico's Walmart unit eyes $1.08 billion capital investments in 2021
DESCRIPTION: Walmart de Mexico, Mexico's largest retailer, said on Thursday that it plans to spend 22.2 billion pesos ($1.08 billion) on capital expenditure this year.

TITLE: Players in GameStop market drama make their case to lawmakers
DESCRIPTION: Wall Street hedge fund managers, the chief executives of Robinhood and Reddit and a YouTube streamer known as Roaring Kitty on Wednesday defended their roles in GameStop's Reddit-fueled stock rally before they face a grilling by lawmakers.

TITLE: L'Oreal sees post-pandemic 'roaring 20s' driving cosmetics rebound
DESCRIPTION: L'Oreal, the world's biggest cosmetics group, forecast a strong rebound in makeup sales when the COVID-19 pandemic gives way to a "roaring 20s" when people get dressed up and go out again to socialise.

TITLE: U.S. markets regulator suspends trading in defunct 'meme stock'
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on Thursday suspended trading in inactive Minnesota corporation SpectraScience Inc., among the latest securities to see a surge in interest from retail investors on social media.

TITLE: Volkswagen Mexico to adjust Jetta output until March 5 over semiconductors
DESCRIPTION: Volkswagen AG's Mexico unit said in a statement on Wednesday it would adjust the production schedule of its Jetta model until March 5 due to a global shortage of semiconductors.

TITLE: Mexican same-store retail sales fell 8.2% in January: ANTAD
DESCRIPTION: Mexican retailers' association ANTAD said on Wednesday that same-store sales fell by 8.2% in January compared with the same month last year.

TITLE: Robinhood, Melvin Capital, Citadel executives expected to testify in Congress on GameStop turmoil: sources
DESCRIPTION: Executives from Robinhood, Melvin Capital and Citadel Securities are expected to testify before a House panel at a Feb. 18 hearing exploring trading turmoil in GameStop Corp and related stocks, said two sources familiar with the matter.

TITLE: EU privacy agency urges more safeguards to curb U.S. tech giants
DESCRIPTION: EU privacy watchdog EDPS on Wednesday backed the bloc's push to curb the power of Apple, Amazon, Alphabet unit Google and Facebook via new tough rules and suggested more safeguards to boost users' privacy rights.

TITLE: COVID, climate, tax feature at first post-Trump G7 talks
DESCRIPTION: The new administration of U.S. President Joe Biden joins international talks on the global economy this week with other rich nations expecting a decisive break from the "America First" nationalism of Donald Trump.

TITLE: Koss family rakes it in from Reddit-fueled rally
DESCRIPTION: The family behind Koss Corp and some of the company's top executives raked in about $45 million from a surge in the headphone maker's stock price during a retail trading blitz that rocked Wall Street last week.

TITLE: Euro zone retail sales rebound more than expected in December
DESCRIPTION: Euro zone retail sales rebounded more than expected in December as Christmas shopping for clothes and shoes caused a surge in sales compared to November, with France and Belgium recording double digit monthly jumps, data showed on Thursday.

TITLE: SEC studies social media posts for signs of fraud in GameStop frenzy: Bloomberg
DESCRIPTION: The U.S. securities regulator is reviewing social media posts for signs of potential fraud in frenzied trading of GameStop Corp's and other companies' shares, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

TITLE: Retail trading fever drives U.S. equity option volumes to record monthly high
DESCRIPTION: Trading volumes in U.S. equity options surged 70% to hit a record monthly high in January, data from Options Clearing Corporation showed, as a retail share trading boom drove extreme gains in some small-cap stocks such as GameStop.

TITLE: Robinhood raises trading limit on five companies
DESCRIPTION: Online trading platform Robinhood said on Tuesday it had raised trading limits on stocks of five companies, including GameStop Corp and AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc.

TITLE: Amazon scores Indian win as court freezes Future's $3.4 billion retail deal
DESCRIPTION: An Indian court blocked Future Group's sale of a swathe of assets to rival Reliance Industries on Tuesday after Amazon raised objections to the $3.4 billion deal, in a battle of the retail titans that could reshape the shopping sector.

TITLE: Exclusive: Robinhood explores raising more debt to fulfill Reddit-fueled order frenzy - sources
DESCRIPTION: Robinhood, the U.S. online broker that has emerged as a gateway for amateur traders challenging Wall Street hedge funds, has held talks with banks about raising $1 billion in debt so it can continue to fulfill orders for heavily shorted stocks, according to people familiar...

TITLE: Europe's 'long the short' trade cools down
DESCRIPTION: European shares caught up in last week's squeeze on hedge funds' short positions have mostly fallen back from their highs, in a sign local retail investors lack the clout of their counterparts in the United States.

TITLE: Tesla set for at least 1 billion euros in German subsidies - Business Insider
DESCRIPTION: U.S. electric vehicle maker Tesla stands to receive at least 1 billion euros ($1.2 billion) in public funding from Germany for setting up a battery cell factory near Berlin, Business Insider reported on Monday.

TITLE: Exclusive: U.S. lobby group urges India not to tighten foreign e-commerce rules
DESCRIPTION: A U.S. lobby group which represents firms including Amazon.com and Walmart has urged India not to tighten foreign investment rules for e-commerce companies again, according to a letter seen by Reuters.

TITLE: Explainer: How retail traders squeezed Wall Street for bets against GameStop
DESCRIPTION: A surge of retail stock trading over the last year lit the fuse that sent shares of GameStop Corp rocketing higher without a clear business reason, market watchers say, squeezing hedge funds that had bet against the video game retailer and other companies that were out of...

TITLE: White House monitoring situation involving GameStop, other firms
DESCRIPTION: The White House and Treasury Department are monitoring the situation involving GameStop and other companies that have seen sharp gains on the stock market, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said on Wednesday.

TITLE: EU lawmakers want Amazon, Apple, Facebook, Google CEOs at Feb. 1 hearing
DESCRIPTION: EU lawmakers have invited the chief executives of Amazon, Apple, Facebook and Alphabet to a Feb. 1 hearing in Brussels as they try to crack down on the powers of U.S. tech giants.

TITLE: Alphabet's Pichai to hold video call with EU antitrust chief Jan. 25
DESCRIPTION: Alphabet Chief Executive Sundar Pichai will hold a video-conference call with EU antitrust chief Margrethe Vestager on Jan. 25, according to a European Commission schedule published on Friday.

TITLE: Amazon Web Services opens first office in Greece
DESCRIPTION: Amazon Inc's cloud computing division opened its first office in Greece on Friday to support what it said was a growing number of companies and public sector agencies using its cloud services.
